noun.description: A rent or other revenue which a person is entitled to receive for life, without the right to dispose of the capital; (also) a right to use and enjoy property during one's life; the enjoyment of this right.

verb.description: To assign (property, etc.) in liferent; to use and enjoy during one's life.

origin: Late 15th century. From life + rent. Compare Middle Dutch lijfrente (Dutch lijfrente), Middle Low German līfrente, German Leibrente<br>mid 17th century. From liferent.
